title: THE FREEDOM OF THOUGHT or NOT
description: ENJOY PHILOSOPHY MEETS WEEKLY EVERY SUNDAY BETWEEN 11.30 AND 14.30 AT EDUARDO VII PARK, HERE:\*\* [https://goo.gl/maps/5e3jKFEweXkNvDdK6](https://goo.gl/maps/5e3jKFEweXkNvDdK6) **ITS THE GARDEN BETWEEN THE ‚ÄúCARLOS LOPES PAVILLION‚Äù AND THE ‚ÄúPRAIA NO PARQUE‚Äù RESTAURANT AT EDUARDO VII PARK.** THIS IS A GROUP FOR ANYONE INTERESTED IN ENJOYING PHILOSOPHY. NO PRIOR KNOWLEDGE IS REQUIRED. ONLY ETERNAL CURIOSITY AND THE PLEASURE OF KNOWLEDGE. PLS KEEP UPDATED of any changes and updates on our WhatsApp Group: [Enjoy Philosophy Lisbon Group Access-Link](https://chat.whatsapp.com/EgaLvlLCAbSL00cYmhpOSu) We will learn, debate, enjoy and investigate philosophers and diverse themes from the philosophical perspective. Each reunion is structured as a conversation among all attendees about that day s philosopher softly moderated by the organizer. The conversation will kick-off from the very brief suggested reading providing easy access to all attendees both to the philosopher and the conversation. Let¬¥s be greek and dive today on‚Ä¶ **THE FREEDOM OF THOUGHT. the last territory of undefeatable human independence, there where he is and historically has been totally sovereign, totally free, totally unreachable, unjudgeable, in other words, whatever happens strictly inside a Human being¬¥s mind is untouchable. In a prison or in a bed, in front of friends and foes, at every moment of our lives we can think, essentially, whatever we want, we can... and as long as those thoughts stayed as thoughts, they have been not only untouchable but also legitimate. You are allowed to imagine whatever yo want, seems to have been an unwritten principle, as long as you don¬¥t act on it... But should this principle be revisited... does it have boundaries ?** **If someone imagine us dead or has sexual fantasies about us, are we legitimated to oppose ? Do we have any right on our image on other people¬¥s minds... or can they do with us in their heads whatever they want?** **Are those the rules of the game... Do we have any kind of rights on another human being¬¥s thoughts... at all?** **Philosophically speaking, the ontological status of thoughts is still nowadays a hot topic. The last resort of total human independence should be outside any kind of ethic ? Or not?** **The empirical freedom of thoughts is also a total independence from any kind of moral compass...? Do fantasies belong strictly to the fantasizer and are totally foreign from the fantasized ?** **Are thoughts, therefore, beyond good and evil... ?** **Let s think about thoughts... and their undefeatable independence...**
subtitle: ENJOY PHILOSOPHY MEETS WEEKLY EVERY SUNDAY BETWEEN 11.30 AND 14.30 AT EDUARDO VII PARK, HERE:\*\* [https://goo.gl/maps/5e3jKFEweXkNvDdK6](https://goo.gl/maps/5e3jKFEweXkNvDdK6) **I
address: Parque Eduardo VII, Lisboa, Lisboa, pt

title: The Art of Meaningful Conversation - PEOPLE PLEASING
description: \-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\- üöß AVOID THE WAITLIST: We save some extra spots for our followers on social media. Like/Subscribe/comment on our latest post with your meetup username and you attendance will be prioritised (but not guaranteed). ‚ñ∂Ô∏è YouTube: @[LifeQuestionsHQ](https://www.youtube.com/@CrowdWisdom) üéµ TikTok: [@LifeQuestionsHQ](https://www.tiktok.com/@lifequestionshq) üì∏ Instagram: [@LifeQuestionsHQ](https://www.instagram.com/lifequestionshq/) üê¶ X (Twitter): [@LifeQuestionsHQ](https://x.com/LifeQuestionsAC) You can also skip the waitlist by [donating](https://www.lifequestions.academy/support-us): ‚úãNO-SHOW POLICY: We have a large waitlist for all our events. It's not fair on those who would like to come but can't because others have taken a space but then didn't come. To reduce the potential, we are implementing a no-show policy: If you don't come to an event that you RSVP (within 48 hours of the event) you will be banned for 1 month for future events. \-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\- üëã Hey, discover how to master your emotional intelligence with a thought-provoking and friendly approach while meeting like-minded people from all over the world. Join us for a modern-day version of an 18th-century salon. Engage in an evening of meaningful conversation without the usual small talk. A place to share personal stories and to learn from diverse ideas. Each week or so we hand-pick a topic and 3 prompt questions to discuss with approximately 20 people from all over the globe, representing dozens of different countries, ages, and backgrounds. **üî• THEME OF EVENT:** PEOPLE PLEASING QUESTIONS: TBD ‚è∞ FORMAT 15.00 - 15.15- Welcome and introductory casual conversation 15:15 - 16:30 - Discussion guided by the event prompt questions 16:15 - 16:30 - Group Discussion with people from other tables. üëÄ WHAT'S THE VIBE Diverse: it's not rare to have people from all continents, as well as people from different ages, religions, ideologies, and backgrounds. Vulnerable: we value real conversations, personal stories and experiences. Casual: some people are having tea, others wine, some listen more, others talk more, some are talking notes, others are fully absorbed in conversation. üí∞ PRICES In person events are organized for FREE but please only come if you are on the guestlist. If perhaps you want to contribute to our emotional and intellectual cause, please visit: https://www.lifequestions.academy/support-us ‚Üí üí¨ WHAT PEOPLE ARE SAYING "A melting pot of enquiring minds sharing personal insights" ‚Äì Catherine Flanagan\, Lisbon \| LQA premium member "With forced distancing and confinement brought about by responses to COVID\, the LQA meetings provide me with one of life's great joys\.\.\. To meet with\, share experiences\, hear different perspectives from people of all walks of life\, different generations\, and different corners of the planet" ‚Äì Scott Ruddell\, Colorado \| LQA premium member ‚ÄúSince joining LQA I have had the opportunity to meet some fantastic people who have a wide range of knowledge and life experience\. Of course\, before participating I was under the impression that one must have read tones of books\, possess a higher IQ or even a quiz master but frankly\, those qualities are not the ethos for LQA\. I personally learned that it‚Äôs about sharing\, coming together with all sorts of knowledge and having growth mindset to learn and hear other people‚Äôs perspective\. Overall\, I would highly recommend joining LQA as it will broaden your horizons and it will enable you to share your world views on a larger scale with like\-minded people\.‚Äù ‚Äì Shah Karim\, London \| LQA premium member ü§© SEE YOU THERE

title: SPEAK & SIP: Language Exchange
description: This time our theme is **News & Media** ‚Äî recent stories, funny or absurd headlines, viral news, and how the same event can look completely different depending on the country reporting it. We‚Äôll talk about where we get our news, what we trust (and what we don‚Äôt), how media shapes our opinions, and how headlines change meaning across languages and cultures. From serious topics to strange news that somehow made it to the front page, this theme is perfect for comparison, critical thinking, and lively discussion. Our languages: English, French, Spanish, Portuguese, Italian, and German. At Speak & Sip, we do things a little differently. There‚Äôs structure ‚Äî but the atmosphere is still relaxed. Think of it as semi-serious, semi-casual: fun and social, but with the clear purpose of improving our language skills. Here‚Äôs how it works: ‚Ä¢ **Each language has its own table** with a host or fluent speakers to guide the group. ‚Ä¢ **Native speakers** are always welcome to join their table and support learners. ‚Ä¢ For the **first hour**, we use conversation cards on the theme to keep things flowing. You‚Äôll switch partners regularly so you can practice with different people. ‚Ä¢ The **second hour** is dedicated to games related to the theme ‚Äî light, interactive, and designed to make everyone speak more. If you want something lighter, there will also be an **English chill table** where people can sit together and talk about any topic. But if your goal is to practice languages in a structured way, this is the right meetup for you. Our aim is simple: to connect through language, to learn from each other, and to make progress while enjoying good company. **[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/BWIfXe0dCFN7RMPt6NG7Mk)** **Follow the community: @forvm.lisbon** ATTENTION This is a **free event**, but to support the venue we kindly ask everyone to **order at least one drink** (even just water). This helps the caf√©/bar keep welcoming our group.

title: Open Coffee Lisbon #46 - New venue
description: We have a new venue. Folklore Cafe, led by Wolfie and Fatema, We had our Christmas party there, and were made to feel very welcome. These videos show the two routes from the street level to the venue. https://www.youtube.com/shorts/hpPwrXcwNpU https://www.youtube.com/shorts/l18Q649nl7Q Open Coffee Lisbon is a friendly informal networking event for entrepreneurs, professionals, locals, guests, people in the startup community, and students in Lisbon.‚Å£ Your host for our event will be [Richard Lucas ](www.linkedin.com/in/richardhlucas/)with support [Jason](https://www.linkedin.com/in/anirvan-jason-gomes-33524024b/) from the Open Coffee Lisbon team You may find a mentor, investor, client, co founder, employer, vendor, inspiration or a friend. Please post your contact details, a link to your Linkedin and/webpage in this group chat, and in our WhatsApp group [here ](https://chat.whatsapp.com/HZNea7wHN0093bOylglaKY)https://chat.whatsapp.com/HZNea7wHN0093bOylglaKY We start at 09:30 AM sharp. Everybody gets up to 2 minutes to present: 1. Who they are and what they are doing 2. What they want 3. How they can help others At 10:30 AM we stop hosting and you can talk to people who are most interesting to you. We are focused on business and social entrepreneurs, the startup community and anyone else who is doing something interesting or wants to get involved in other people's projects. You can talk about any project/topic. Open Coffee Lisbon is an ‚Äúun-meeting‚Äù without a speaker or agenda. We are focused on attendees gaining value from other attendees. The rules, tools, structure and moderation aim to facilitate this goal. ‚Å£‚Å£What is the BIG idea behind Open Coffee? We want to help people create useful business connections.‚Å£ Everyone is welcome to our meetings, and we especially love first-timers.‚Å£ ‚Å£We want to make sure that if somebody coming from an unsupportive background/country has the courage to join, they will notice that we are glad they came because we welcome them. If you feel shy, you can also just listen but we encourage you to talk. Each attendee can also get to show their LinkedIn page or website through our channels and showcase their idea.‚Å£ This event is based on the Open Coffee Krakow format, run by Richard Lucas and others in Krakow Poland since 2012. If you want to help and get involved in making this gathering a regular part of the Lisbon eco-system please let us know [here](https://forms.gle/hjQUMyFap5K8yo8y9) https://forms.gle/hjQUMyFap5K8yo8y9 if you are interested in knowing more about the Open Coffee format, take a look at our video for potential leaders [here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z99E2z8anFU). We have events in Cambridge, Krakow, Ericeira, Sydney, Warsaw and soon Tirana according to our format, When you sign up to our events we add you to our [mailing list](https://lisboncommunityevents.substack.com/) https://lisboncommunityevents.substack.com so we can tell you about more free events run by volunteers . If you don't want us to do that don't give us your email. If you change your mind you can leave the Substack mailing list at any time.
subtitle: We have a new venue
address: Mercado de Sapadores, Rua da Penha de Fran√ßa 13, Lisboa, Lisboa, pt

title: Open Coffee Lisbon Evening Social
description: Join us for the **Open Coffee Lisbon Evening Social**‚Äîa relaxed, welcoming gathering designed for anyone in Lisbon‚Äôs vibrant startup and professional community who wants to connect beyond the usual business talk. Hosted by Richard Lucas and the friendly Open Coffee Lisbon team, this event is all about genuine conversations, new friendships, and building a supportive network in a laid-back atmosphere. Many of our current event participants head out for lunch to hang out after our sell out morning meetings. We decided to offer a more social event in fabulous setting. Whether you‚Äôre an entrepreneur, student, creative, tourist, or simply curious, you‚Äôll find a space where everyone is encouraged to mingle, share stories, and discover common interests. Our events are open and welcoming to people from all backgrounds and ages. Many different nationalities come together at our events, as well as long term Lisbon residents. Our motto "we welcome all, who welcome all." **This is not a speed dating/pickup type event. Everyone who attends is entitled to feel safe, not be harassed or pressured.** **EVENT STRUCTURE:** We will have a structured first sixty minutes with icebreakers aimed at making things easy for people to connect with one another. Then participants are welcome to hang out and socialise as they wish after the structured part of the meeting is over. **REACH OUT:** If you have a community initiative you want to share or announce, let us know in advance. **VOLUNTEERS** We need volunteers to help us develop the project. From simple things like being early to welcome people, through to PR and graphic design and a website. Let us know if that sounds like you and apply to join the team [here](https://forms.gle/EeLboZcYBrLesVt26) Newcomers are especially welcome, and if you‚Äôre feeling shy, don't worry. you‚Äôre free to listen or join in at your own pace. Bring your ideas, your curiosity, and your favourite conversation starters. Share your LinkedIn or project links with the group, and let‚Äôs help each other grow‚Äîpersonally and professionally. This evening is about making connections that matter, all in a friendly, inclusive setting. If you‚Äôd like to help shape future gatherings or feature in our community newsletter, let us know. Come for the connections, stay for the camaraderie! Please let us know if you can volunteer and help [here](https://forms.gle/EeLboZcYBrLesVt26) **Please note that the evening entrance is from the sea front. Use [this link](https://maps.app.goo.gl/4aNCJLp9JXRqCsUC6) to find your way from the Metro.** if you are at the "City" side entrance of Titanic [here](https://maps.app.goo.gl/tEb6MmBNxoaBZhcHA) , and can't figure out how to get in, check [this video ](https://youtube.com/shorts/gq0QQ_RnNbQ?si=rKthOudD36TIS5GB)It's only 8 seconds long. The correct pin for the entrance is [here](https://maps.app.goo.gl/Zjkfu5hVCeEV5miH8)

description: **Lisbon Real Estate & Investment Talks @ Le Consulat (Chiado)** Join us for an informal, international meetup about **buying, investing, and living in Portugal** ‚Äî with a strong focus on **Lisbon and its surrounding areas**. This is a friendly evening to learn, ask questions, and meet people who are navigating the market (or already investing) ‚Äî over drinks in the heart of Chiado. ### **What we‚Äôll cover** * **Portugal buying process**: the steps, common pitfalls, and timelines * **Market pulse**: what‚Äôs happening right now in Lisbon (prices, demand, typical strategies) * **Investor Q&A**: financing, rentals (long-term vs. short-term), yields, and due diligence * **Networking**: meet buyers, investors, and locals with real experience (bring your questions) ### **Who should come?** * If you‚Äôre planning to **buy** in Portugal * If you‚Äôre looking for an **investment** * If you want to understand the market and build a local network * If you're curious and want to share a good time **Language:** English (questions welcome in French / Portuguese too) **Format:** short talk + open Q&A + networking (casual, no pressure) I‚Äôll also introduce the professionals I work with regularly ‚Äî typically including a **real-estate lawyer**, **mortgage broker**, architect, civil engineer and other trusted partners (tax/accounting, renovation, property management/concierge), so you know who to call depending on your situation. A big thank you to **Tribe Social Club** for hosting us at this beautiful Chiado location overlooking Pra√ßa Lu√≠s de Cam√µes. *Disclaimer: this meetup is for education and networking ‚Äî not financial or legal advice.*
